posts.post_content:
This card runs my main deck. Perfect for a Green/Black combo. [Culling the Weak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling the Weak), [Dryad Arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Arbor) and [Shinen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shinen) cards are just some ideas to use with it. Like [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant), it opens up many new and interesting combos with cards that would otherwise be rather mediocre.  
  
Of course, don't forget [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive) to get it and some nice creatures into your graveyard.  
  
5/5
posts.html:
This card runs my main deck. Perfect for a Green/Black combo. Culling the Weak, Dryad Arbor and Shinen cards are just some ideas to use with it. Like Painter's Servant, it opens up many new and interesting combos with cards that would otherwise be rather mediocre.

Of course, don't forget Buried Alive to get it and some nice creatures into your graveyard.

5/5

posts.post_content:
I just love how two of my favorite cards ever printed also make one of the best combos.  
  
Get this guy in the graveyard with [wild mongrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wild mongrel) or something, and then play [spore frog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spore frog)...for four mana a turn, you completely shut down your opponents attack.

posts.post_content: This card locked me out of an EDH game against [Child of Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Child of Alara). It kept recurring [Eternal Witness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Witness) and [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph) to either kill my general, or kill his general and get a bonus [Planar Cleansing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Planar Cleansing) every turn. Far from pleasant.

Posted By: DacenOctavio (10/15/2012 6:10:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Probably one of the worst incarnations. Oh, it's a great card, sure-- it's just that when I look at the whole cycle, I see I can get free haste for everyone in red, free flying for everyone in blue, and free...swampwalk? ok, so I would have preferred fear -.- ...for everyone in black.   
  
Not to dis the specialized decks that make excellent use of this card, but Wonder, Anger, and Filth are just so all-purpose good (in EDH, you can usually expect someone to eventually play a Swamp. Black is a popular color.), that to see a card in the same cycle that both costs mana to activate and merely returns to hand rather than directly to the battlefield....  
  
I guess I'm a little underwhelmed, and probably spoiled. The one that gives Trample for free to everyone is more fun in my book, but I know that this card does not suck either.
posts.html:

Not to dis the specialized decks that make excellent use of this card, but Wonder, Anger, and Filth are just so all-purpose good (in EDH, you can usually expect someone to eventually play a Swamp. Black is a popular color.), that to see a card in the same cycle that both costs mana to activate and merely returns to hand rather than directly to the battlefield....

I guess I'm a little underwhelmed, and probably spoiled. The one that gives Trample for free to everyone is more fun in my book, but I know that this card does not suck either.
